metadata.title: CVE-2022-1048 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s sound subsystem inthe way a user triggers concurrent calls of PCM hw_params. The hw_freeioctls or similar race condition happens inside ALSA PCM for other ioctls.This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-dell300x - 4.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1080-gke - 5.4.0-1080.86~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-gkeop - 5.4.0-1051.54~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1117-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1117.125
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1135-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1135.145
No subscription required
